description: It's better to run from terminal by sudo to check SMART attributes and collect dmidecode output.
Good to list hardware
Perfect database
It's not explained very well but once the program runs, click the link it gives you to connect to your detailed system information.
summary: Finally found the info I needed with this App

description: This app led me to the drivers I had been serching for. Im a neubie, but im learning. Good job guys!
Did not detect touchscreen input device, even though the Ubunto 19,04 kernel does
summary: Maybe needs updating for recent distros

description: It claims that "Private info is not collected", however, upload of any data should be done with explicit consent.
summary: Uploads your machine data to a server

description: for ubutu bionic 18.04
Need to run by sudo from terminal to check hdds.
I get all the hardware info, but it is uploaded to linux-hardware.org, so if everytime I want to probe I will need an internet connection and view the URL link. Would prefer an offline version.

Someone, with better Linux understanding than I have, should have a look at this app - something is very fishy about the whole setup.

Starting the app on my machine ... get a URL to 
https://linux-hardware.org/?probe=xxxxx"

a few clicks later I am at yandex mirror - where it offers me an .iso - i'm not entirely sure what - a ROSA project from 2016.

It appears that this software uploads all my system information, as well as other info and log files ie. network. Why is that? The website is called https: linix-hardware-org or something like that. What's up with that? Until further notice, I'm uninstalling this app from my laptop.
It is common but NOT good practice to upload Hardware data to a 3dr party website and leave it veiwable on the internet. This needs to get flagged or remove until the DEV ask before shooting.
summary: SENDS COLLECTED DATA TO /RD PARTY SERVER WITHOUT ASKING

description: Once you open it starts the process. No confirmation, just uploads all your hardware info. Gives a crappy way to view info to boot.
summary: Once you open it starts the process

description: i use this software very nice...

it listed all my drivers and the prob with them and how to fix it
just click the link in the terminal to see the list

When I run: "sudo -E hw-probe -all -upload" I get "sudo: hw-probe: command not found"

But I run "hw-probe -v or -h" and I get a response. I am probably using the command wrong.
Good for exploring my hardware.
Found missed drivers

I installed Ubuntu on my 2011 windows machine and this software gem found all the hardware and I was able to print it out and save it as a PDF file for later use. Also suggested drivers (were not needed) if I had problems.

When you run this, a terminal chugs along and after about a minute gives a link. When you open the link you see an easy to read list of all your hardware and drivers. 

It gently revealed that my 2011 scanner has no Ubuntu 18 driver.
New web UI rocks.
When you look at the web description, ermissions don't include internet access. But the CLI asks for root, then uploads (hopefully only) your hardward data to linux-hardware.org.
summary: uses root to get internet access

description: What I thought I wanted was an application like what I would get on windows that would give me a hardware list. Over time I have learned that CentOS is not going to give me that. This is just as good. Single line of code that spits out a web address that gives me all the information I need.
summary: Exactly what I have been looking for!

description: doesn't work, or it is super slow?

Uploads all info to online database without prompting or the ability to review first. Website linux-hardware.org crosslinks to yandex.ru. Default permissions are set to access personal files and folders. Use at your own risk!

Added graphical interface explaining privacy policy and prompting user to submit data to Linux database if desired.

Also you can view collected raw data and open probe in your browser with the help of new graphical interface.

DE 	XFCE (X11) - LightDM

in just one click I knew my name, where I am, what I'm doing, why I'm here, who I am with, including details of scenarios never even imagined.

 sudo -E hw-probe -all -upload
summary: Excellent eBayer. Item sent out quickly and well packaged. Thank you

description:
Dank der Infobox bei der Hardware war ich in der Lage heraus zu finden wie ich eine nicht funktionierende Hardware in Betrieb nehmen konnte.
alles suchen im Internet hatte mir vorher nicht geholfen.
summary: Gibt einem eine tolle Zusammenfassung zum eigenen System

description: doesn't work, sorry

Macht genau was es soll, super in der Zusammenfassung
hilft bei Problemen, 5 *****

kann bei einigen hardware kombis ganz hilfreich sein ob was funktioniert. habe bei meinen hp einen fingerprint der nicht funktioniert, und habe einige anleitungen durch und nichts half ihm zum laufen zu bringen. mit diesem tool wurde auch mir gezeit das der fingerprint unter keiner ubuntu bzw. aktuellen kernel geht, daher finde ich das programm sehr nützlich.
hay drivers que estan funcionando y solo dice "detectado" y debería decir "works"
Une bonne chose.
